intro: Aegonychon calabrum, commonly known as the Calabrian thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple, followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
